An index of the Emblems contained in this Volume.
The Authors epigramme
The Authors epistle
The Authors Præface to the Reader
Wind carryd him to his belly
The earth is his Nource
Goe to the woman washing cloaths, and doe you after the same manner.
Joyne the brother with the sister and give them a cup of love
Put a toad upon the womans breasts, that shee may give it sucke,
and the woman dye, and the toad be grosse with milke
Sow your gold in the white foliated earth
A chicken is flying out of the nest, which falls againe into the nest.
Take an egge and smite it with a fiery sword
Shutt up the tree with the old man in the house of dew, and
eating of the fruit thereof hee will become young
Give fire to fire, Mercury to Mercury, and you have enough
Whiten Latona, and tear your books
The stone, which Saturne vomited up, being devoured instead
of his Sonne Jupiter, is placed in Helicon as a monument to men.
The Philosophers brasse is hydropicall, and desires to be seven
times washd in a river, as Naaman the leper in Jordan
This is the Dragon which devoures his tayle
Let the worke of the Potter, consisting in siccity and moisture
instruct you
One Lyon hath wings, the other none
Foure orbes governe this worke of fire
Fire loves to burne, not to aurify, but gold
If you kill one of the four they will all suddenly dye
Nature teacheth nature how to subdue fire
Make of the man and the woman a circle, of that a quadrangle,
of this a triangle, of the same a circle, and you will have the Phil. Stone
Having acquired white lead doe the worke of women, that is, boyle
When Pallas was borne, and Sol lay with Venue, it rained
gold at Rhodes
A wolfe devoured the King, and being burned restored him
to life againe
The dragon dyes not except hee be killd by his brother and
Sister, which are Sol and Luna
The tree of life is the fruit of humane wisedome Page
Hee that endeavours to enter into the Philosophers rosary
without a key, is like him that would walke without feet
The King sitting in a bath is bathed, and freed from melan
choly by Pharut
As the Salamander lives in fire, soe allso the stone
Luna is as requisite to Sol as a henne to a cocke
The King swimming in the Sea cryes out with a loud voyce, hee
that will deliver mee shall have great reward
As Corall growes under water, and is hardened by the aire, soe allso
is the Stone
The Hermaphrodite lying like a dead man in darknesse, wants fire
Hee is conceived in baths, and borne in the aire, and being made
red walks upon the waters
As Ceres accustomed Triptolemus, and Thetis Achilles to abide in
fire, soe allso doth an Artist the stone
The stone, that is, Mercury is cast upon the earth, and exacted on moun
tains, and resides in the aire, and is nourished in water
Three things are sufficient for the Magistery, the white fume, that is, water,
the green Lyon, that is, the brasse of Hermes, and Aqua fætida
Rebis is, as Hermaphroditus, produced from the two mountains of
Mercury and Venus
Œdipus having overcome Sphynx and killd his father Laius, marryed
his mother Jocaster
Of two waters make one, and that will be the water of sanctity
Adonis is killd by a boar, to whom Venus hasting, tinged the roses with her blood
Nature, Reason, Experience, and Reading, must be the guide, staffe,
Spectacles, and lampe to him that is employd in Chymicall affairs
Give ear to the Vulturs words which are no=wise false
Typhon kills Osyris by deceipt, and disperseth the parts of his body on
all sides, but the famous Isis gathered them together
The worke is perfected by Sol and his shade
Two Eagles, come together, one from the East, the other from the West
A wolfe coming from the East, and a dogge from the West worryd one another
The King falls sicke by drinking water, and is restord to
health by Physicians
The Philosophicall infant is, as Orion, the Sonne of three fathers
The Dragon kills the woman, and shee him, and are both
bloody all over
Finis
